tags.description:
From here you may browse our library of API resources, organized hierarchically by domain, or major functional area, logical subgroup, API resource, and all available operations against that resource. For more information about the concepts and technology behind our API, refer to the [Getting started](C:636f581c-50a8-41a7-af43-e5057f9c20bd) documentation.

Our platform provides a powerful application programming interface and documentation to help you develop secure, scalable, and high-performance applications that leverage the full breadth of capabilities offered by our backend services.

The Workforce Management suite's API is founded on a pragmatic implementation of the [representational state transfer](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_State_Transfer) architectural style and allows access to your organization's workforce management data using common HTTP methods and the [JSON](http://www.json.org) interchange format.
tags.name: API

tags.description: This resource allows you to import actual volumes, which represent the raw values associated with past business volume.
tags.name: Actual Volume

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and update the value of adjustment drivers, which are used to generate labor forecasts.
tags.name: Adjustment Drivers

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve all combined distribution offset types, which indicate the way to allocate labour outside of the defined distribution period.
tags.name: Combined Distribution Offset Types

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve all combined distribution types, which indicate the way resources remaining after labour calculation are distributed within the configured labor period.
tags.name: Combined Distribution Types

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve consolidated labor forecast values. A consolidated labor forecast predicts the number of hours required per job to fulfill a projected amount of business.
tags.name: Consolidated Labor Forecast

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve Custom Drivers. Custom Drivers includes labor data that does not vary by volume or by static value.
tags.name: Custom Drivers Setup

tags.description: This resource allows you to create and retrieve daily actual volume. Daily actual volume indicates how much business was done in the past.
tags.name: Daily Actual Volume

tags.description: This resource allows you to run the earned hours engine. The earned forecast hours engine generates earned hours values based on actual volume data for a provided site or department category and a given forecast week.
tags.name: Earned Hours Engine

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve the status of forecasting engine runs.
tags.name: Engine Status

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve forecasted jobs.
tags.name: Forecasted Jobs

tags.description:
Forecasting allows you to provision and run forecasting operations, which provide the ability to view and modify volume forecasts and labor forecasts that the Scheduler uses to create schedules.

The Forecast Manager uses actual Point Of Sale (POS) and other business data from previous weeks and years to forecast business volume for a future date. This POS and business data is also known as volume driver data. The system forecasts volume at the daily level using the rules, business drivers, and special events that you set up.

From historical volume driver data, the Forecast Manager derives a traffic pattern. Then, applying your labor standards to volume driver data, as well as non-volume data, the Forecast Manager generates a labor forecast in 15-minute intervals, one week at a time.

From the labor forecast, the Scheduler looks at individual employees and schedule rules to create a 15-minute interval schedule, one week at a time, for each selected location.

The system uses the elements you configure to generate the volume forecast, the labor forecast, and the schedule.
tags.name: Forecasting

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve forecasting audit data.
tags.name: Forecasting Audits

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete Forecasting Category Profiles, which control which forecast categories a manager can see and assign.
tags.name: Forecasting Category Profiles

tags.description: This resource allows you to create and retrieve labor budget values, which indicate planned labor hours and costs according to a budget plan.
tags.name: Labor Budget

tags.description: This resource allows you to run the labor constraint engine. The labor constraint engine generates adjusted labor forecast values for a provided site or department category and a given forecast week.
tags.name: Labor Constraint Engine

tags.description:
This resource allows you to execute the Labor Forecast analyzer.

The labor forecast analyzer helps explain the results of a labor forecast by reporting the labor data used to produce the forecast.
tags.name: Labor Forecast Analyzer

tags.description: This resource allows you to run the labor forecast engine. The labor forecast engine generates labor forecast values for a provided site or department category and a given forecast week.
tags.name: Labor Forecast Engine

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete labor forecast limit assignments. Labor forecast limits include minimum and maximum labor coverage requirements for jobs and job rounding factors.
tags.name: Labor Forecast Limit Assignments

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate labor period overrides, by which managers can override the existing labor period configuration defined in the system in the Labor Standard Forecasting setup page.
tags.name: Labor Period Overrides

tags.description: This resource allows you to execute the traffic pattern engine. The traffic pattern engine generates interval-based traffic patterns for a set of Forecasting categories according to a specified site or department category and a forecast week.
tags.name: Traffic Pattern Engine

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate traffic patterns. Traffic patterns indicate how business volume fluctuates during a day.
tags.name: Traffic Patterns

tags.description:
This resource allows you to execute the Forecasting volume analyzer.

The volume analyzer helps explain the results of a volume forecast by reporting the volume data used to produce the forecast and by analyzing reported volumes and the extent to which those volumes deviate from defined norms.
tags.name: Volume Analyzer

tags.description: This resource allows you to create and retrieve volume budgets, which specify the planned amounts for various business drivers.
tags.name: Volume Budget

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve, update, and restore volume forecast.
tags.name: Volume Forecast

tags.name: Volume Forecast Engine

tags.description: This resource allows you to run the volume forecast intervals engine. The volume forecast intervals engine generates volume forecast interval values.
tags.name: Volume Forecast Intervals Engine

tags.description:
This resource allows you to retrieve volume forecasts.

The volume forecast is a prediction of how much business is going to be done at a future date. The Forecast Planner predicts weekly business volumes by day of the week based on:

  • Large samples of historical, actual POS volume data
  • Configured forecast rules
  • Adjustments to the predicted volumes for special events such as promotions and holidays

The volume forecast is a major component used to generate the labor forecast. For example, the number of forecasted transactions at a register drives the requirement for the number of cashiers that need to be working, the number of items forecasted to be sold in the bakery drives the requirement for the number of bakers on a given day, and so on.

Before the system can forecast volume, you must:

  • Create volume drivers and assigned them to forecast categories.
  • Define special events and assign them to forecast categories.
  • Import actual volume data and other business data.
tags.name: Volume Forecasts

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve all types of Week Symbolic Periods. Week Symbolic Periods are required during factor definition and allow the end user to filter factor data by time span.
tags.name: Week Symbolic Periods

The associated Access Control Point is WFF_ACTUAL_VOLUME.


Service limit

post.description:
This operation imports actual volumes for a given date span.


Note: This operation allows a request payload size of 10 megabytes and supports HTTP status code 207 Partial Success responses.


Best Practices

Historical POS


Use this operation to import historical point-of-sale (POS) data. This operation is the best way to perform historical imports for new customers or when new stores are added.


Always specify one complete store structure in each call--that is, include all categories under a particular store.


Always specify one store for as many months as possible up to a maximum recommended span of one year. Within that range, adjust the timeframe based on the number of external labels (drivers and forecast categories).


Note: You will experience poor performance if you create multiple calls per store, each call importing only certain categories of that store for a particular date range.

Daily POS


Use this operation to import daily point-of-sale (POS) data.


Always specify one complete store structure in each call--that is, include all categories under a particular store.


Always specify one store for as many days or weeks as desired.


Note: You will experience poor performance if you create multiple calls per store, each call importing only certain categories of that store for a particular date range.

parameters.description: The Import Actual Volume request payload, containing a list of actual volumes.
parameters.name: body

post.description:
This operation updates the values associated with one or more adjustment drivers at the department or store level. Adjustment driver updates are per week, though multiple weeks can be specified in a request. If an adjustment driver is updated at the department level, all departments under one store must be part of the same request payload.


The associated Access Control Point is WFF_ADJUSTMENT_DRIVER_DATA.


Note: This operation allows a request payload size of 5 megabytes and supports HTTP status code 207 Partial Success responses.


Best Practices


When updating at the department level, always specify one complete store structure in each call--that is, include all departments in a particular store. Adjust the date range based on payload size and in terms of weeks.


For the best performance:


  • Department-level updates: import all departments for one store for one or more weeks, depending on payload size
  • Store-level updates: import one or more stores for one or more weeks

Note: You will experience poor performance if you create multiple calls per store, each call importing only certain departments under that store for a particular week or weeks.

get.description: This operation returns all combined distribution types. Valid types include: SPREAD_LEFT: Spreads the remaining resources in the resource pool starting at the beginning of the distribution time period. SPREAD_RIGHT: Spreads remaining resources in the resource pool starting at the end of the distribution time period. OPTIMAL_SPREAD: Redistributes any remaining labor to the appropriate time periods in the labor forecast curve.

post.description:
This operation imports labor budgets.


Note: This operation allows a request payload size of 5 megabytes, supports HTTP status code 207 Partial Success responses, and requires that all departments and jobs under a store are included in each call.


Service limit

A service limit constrains the number of days multiplied by the number of jobs that can be processed in a single request.

  • The Number of Days multiplied by the Number of Jobs cannot exceed 30,000.

Note: This service limit is only enforced when the jobsLaborBudgets request property is specified.

Refer to the Docs > Service Limits topic for more information.


Best Practices


Always specify one complete store structure in each call--that is, include all child departments and jobs under a particular store. Adjust the date range based on payload size, with a minimum recommended date range of one week and a maximum of up to several months.


For the best performance:


  • import one complete store per week or per month

Note: You will experience poor performance if you create multiple calls per store, each call importing only certain departments and jobs under that store for a particular date range.

parameters.description: The Import Labor Budgets request payload, containing a date range and a collection of department labor budgets.
parameters.name: body

post.description:
This operation imports volume budgets.


Note: This operation allows a request payload size of 5 megabytes, supports HTTP status code 207 Partial Success responses, and requires that all locations under a store have a direct driver assigned.


Best Practices


Always specify one complete store structure in each call--that is, include all child locations under a particular store. Adjust the date range based on payload size, with a minimum recommended date range of one week and a maximum of up to one year.


For the best performance:


  • Yearly imports: import one complete store with a date range of several months or up to one year, depending on payload size
  • Weekly imports: import one complete store per week

Note: You will experience poor performance if you create multiple calls per store, each call importing only certain locations under that store for a particular date range.

Refer to the Docs > Service Limits topic for more information.

endTime.description: The end time of a labor period override item in ISO_LOCAL_TIME format (HH:mm:ss.SSS). This property only accepts time in 15 minute increments and only accepts seconds if they are passed as zeroes. For example, valid times include 00:15, 12:30, 23:45, and so on. This property can only be specified when the selected period of application type is Absolute.

offsetInMinutes.description: The labor period override item offset in minutes. This property only accepts numbers in 15 minute increments and in the inclusive range -705 to 720. This property can only be specified when the selected period of application type is HOO_Close or HOO_Open.

startTime.description: The start time of a labor period override item in ISO_LOCAL_TIME format (HH:mm:ss.SSS). This property only accepts time in 15 minute increments and only accepts seconds if they are passed as zeroes. For example, valid times include 00:15, 12:30, 23:45, and so on. This property can only be specified when the selected period of application type is Absolute.
